Package polyglot.ast

Class Term_c

java.lang.Object
polyglot.ast.Node_c
polyglot.ast.Term_c
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Node, NodeOps, Term, TermOps, Copy<Node>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AnnotationElem_c, AnnotationElemDecl_c, ClassBody_c, ClassDecl_c, ElementValueArrayInit_c, ElementValuePair_c, EnumConstantDecl_c, Expr_c, FieldDecl_c, Formal_c, Initializer_c, LambdaExpression, MethodReference, ProcedureDecl_c, Stmt_c, Term.Instance, TypeNode_c
public abstract class Term_c
extends Node_c
implements Term, TermOps
A Term represents any Java expression or statement on which dataflow can be performed.
See Also:

    • reachable

      public boolean reachable()
      Description copied from interface: Term
      Returns true if the term is reachable. This attribute is not guaranteed correct until after the reachability pass.
      Specified by:

    • exceptions

      public SubtypeSet exceptions()
      Description copied from interface: Term
      List of Types with all exceptions possibly thrown by this term. The list is not necessarily correct until after exception-checking. polyglot.ast.NodeOps.throwTypes() is similar, but exceptions are not propagated to the containing node.
      Specified by:
      exceptions in interface Term

    • exceptionCheck

      public Node exceptionCheck​(ExceptionChecker ec) throws SemanticException
      Description copied from interface: NodeOps
      Check that exceptions are properly propagated throughout the AST. This method is called by the leave() method of the visitor. The method should perform work that should be done after visiting the children of the node. The method may return this or a new copy of the node which will be installed as a child of the node's parent.
      Specified by:
      exceptionCheck in interface NodeOps
      Overrides:
      exceptionCheck in class Node_c
      Parameters:
      ec - The visitor.
      Throws:
      SemanticException

    • extRewrite

      public Node extRewrite​(ExtensionRewriter rw) throws SemanticException
      Description copied from interface: NodeOps
      Rewrite the AST for the compilation in this language. This method is called by the leave() method of the visitor. The method should perform work that should be done after visiting the children of the node. The method may return this or a new copy of the node which will be installed as a child of the node's parent.
      Specified by:
      extRewrite in interface NodeOps
      Overrides:
      extRewrite in class Node_c
      Parameters:
      rw - The visitor.
      Throws:
      SemanticException

    • firstChild

      public abstract Term firstChild()
      Description copied from interface: TermOps
      Return the first direct subterm performed when evaluating this term. If this term has no subterms, this should return null. This method is similar to the deprecated entry(), but it should *not* recursively drill down to the innermost subterm. The direct child visited first in this term's dataflow should be returned.
      Specified by:
      firstChild in interface TermOps

    • acceptCFG

      public abstract <T> java.util.List<T> acceptCFG​(CFGBuilder<?> v, java.util.List<T> succs)
      Description copied from interface: TermOps
      Visit this term in evaluation order, calling v.edge() for each successor in succs, if data flows on that edge.
      Specified by:
      acceptCFG in interface TermOps
